cip.render.raytrace.geometry

Class HyperParaboloid

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.AGeometry
      • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.AQuadricGeo
        • cip.render.raytrace.geometry.HyperParaboloid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtGeometry

    public class HyperParaboloid
extends AQuadricGeo
    This is the implementation of an hyperbolic paraboloid of some radii centered at 0,0,0 in the object coordinate system.

    The hyperbolic paraboloid is specified as a node in an XML file as: 

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.geometry.HyperParaboloid" name="ellipsoidName">
         <radius>radius</radius>
         <radius>Xradius,Yradius,Zradius</radius>
         <MaterialByRef name="materialName"/>
         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="materialClass">
               .
             material specific nodes and attributes
               .
         </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    where:
    radius The radii of the hyperbolic paraboloid. This is specified either as a single value which is applied to i, j, and k; or as 3 values that will be applied as X radius, Y radius, and Z radius individually. The default is a hyperbolic paraboloid with X, Y, and Z radii of 1.0, 2.0, and 3.0 if not specified.
    MaterialByRef The specification fof a material for the hyperbolic paraboloid. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. The dynamically loaded object must implement the IRtMaterial interface. If no material is specified, the material defaults to matte green material.
    DynamicallyLoadedObject The specification for a material for the hyperbolic paraboloid. MaterialByRef is mutually exclusive with the DynamicallyLoadedObject specification of a material. The dynamically loaded object must implement the IRtMaterial interface. If no material is specified, the material defaults to matte green material.

    Example of XML Specification

    The following specifies a hyperbolic paraboloid of radii 5, 3, and 2:

         <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.geometry.HyperParaboloid" name="hyperbolic paraboloid">
         <radius>5,3,2</radius>
         <MaterialByRef name="blue"/>
     </DynamicallyLoadedObject>
    Since:
    1.0

      • loadFromXml

        public void loadFromXml(@NotNull
                        @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element xmlElement,
                        java.util.LinkedList<INamedObject> refObjectList)
                 throws DynXmlObjParseException
        Description copied from interface: IDynXmlObject
        Loads this object from an XML DOM Document element. The DynXmlObjLoader has parsed the element and attributes to determine that this is a dynamically loaded object, found and instantiated the class, and is now sending the node to the object so it can initialize itself based on the contents of the node.
        Specified by:
        loadFromXml in interface IDynXmlObject
        Overrides:
        loadFromXml in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - The dynamically loaded object DOM Document element.
        refObjectList - A linked list if named objects (implementing the INamedObject interface) that have already been loaded and can be used to resolve object references.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the object. If this exception is thrown it should be assumed that this object was incorrectly initialized, is invalid, and should not be used in any further operations.

      • internalToXml

        protected void internalToXml(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        Description copied from class: AGeometry
        Override this function to add object-specific information to an XML node.
        Overrides:
        internalToXml in class AGeometry
        Parameters:
        element - The dynamically loaded object node that the object-specific information should be written into. The IDynXmlObject.loadFromXml(Element, LinkedList) funtcion must be overridden by the geometry implementation to be able to read the object-specific information set by the object here.
